hed: Is Sleep Training Harmful?
tease: We examined the social media and medical discourse on infant sleep training.

hed: Who killed the world?
tease: Explore science fiction worlds from the last few decades – and what these fictional settings tell us about ourselves.

hed: Failures to Act
tease: We analyzed 1,281 court documents of alleged child abuse in New Hampshire youth facilities. Here’s what they show.

hed: Climate Zones
tease: Explore how your city will feel in the future.

hed: This is a teenager
tease: Watch hundreds of teenagers grow up into adults – and see how their lives turn out.

hed: The Flipbook Experiment
tease: The results from making a crowd-sourced flipbook animation.

hed: What Makes an Album the Greatest of All Time?
tease: We examined what shapes “greatness” in music, according to Rolling Stone's 500 greatest albums of all time.

hed: Quantifying the Diva-ness of 138 National Anthem Performances
tease: We listened to 138 National Anthem performances so you don't have to. Here are the biggest divas.

hed: You should look at this chart about music genres.
tease: Spotify tracks over 6,000 genres—everything from "rock" to "stomp-and-holler." Here's why that's cool.

hed: What Does a Happily Ever After Look Like?
tease: What does a happily ever after look like? We look at over 1,400 romance covers to find out what visuals are used.

hed: 24 hours in an invisible epidemic
tease: Watch 24 hours of an American day, and the invisible crisis hiding in plain sight.

hed: Data Clocks
tease: A series of experimental clocks that connect data to time.

hed: Mapping Record-High Heat in U.S. Cities
tease: We're tracking how the hottest year on Earth is affecting U.S. heat records.

hed: Songwriting credits since 1958, broken down by gender
tease: This is how rare it is for a hit song to be credited to an all-women songwriting team.

hed: Asterisking NBA Champions
tease: Introducing CRUTCH, Our New Metric For Asterisking NBA Champions.

hed: Wonky
tease: We break down J Dilla's signature off-beat timefeel.

hed: They Won't Play A Lady-O on Country Radio
tease: Country music is powered by women like Carrie Underwood and Maren Morris, but even they are barely played back-to-back.

hed: The search for my kimchi
tease: Alvin loved his grandmother's fresh kimchi. But as he aged, could he rediscover the defining flavor of his childhood?

hed: How companies use dark patterns to keep you subscribed
tease: We unsubscribed from 16 subscription services and documented the ways companies made it challenging.

hed: Where in the USA is this?
tease: We made a short daily photo location guessing game that is a mashup of GeoGuessr and Wordle.

hed: A Map of Places in the US with the Same Name
tease: Portland, Maine, or Oregon? We calculated what place someone is most likely referring to, depending on where they are.

hed: The Greatest Unexpected NBA Performances
tease: We used statistics to find out which NBA players have had the greatest unexpected performances.

hed: What Literature Do we Study from the 1990s?
tease: We explored university syllabi to identify the literary canon.

hed: Why the Super Rich are Inevitable
tease: Why some mathematicians argue the economy is designed to create a few super rich people – unless we stop it.

hed: How Are You Doing?
tease: A journey of emotional awareness, where we uncover the power of naming and visualizing your feelings.

hed: Upward Mobility
tease: How does where you grow up impact your economic opportunity? Our author returns to his roots.

hed: A Visual History of WNBA Kicks
tease: Watch women's hoops signature sneakers morph from Swoopes to Stewie.

hed: Words Against Strangers
tease: One random person a day gets the chance to play against the internet in a game of words. Can you beat them?

hed: The Sounds of CDMX
tease: Take an audio tour of Mexico City, seen through its street vendors.

hed: The Big [Censored] Theory
tease: We watched 100 episodes of The Big Bang Theory to figure out what the government in China censors, and why.

hed: The Unlikely Odds of Making it Big on TikTok
tease: Is TikTok helping artists become commercially successful, or does the medium present a new opportunity worth pursuing?

hed: How Artists Get Paid From Streaming
tease: Ever wonder what happens when you press play on your favorite song? We look how artists get paid from streaming music.

hed: A Visual Guide to the Aztec Pantheon
tease: Curious what your teachers never taught you about the Aztec Gods? Here's an illustrated introduction.

hed: Tracking Heat Records in 400 U.S. Cities
tease: We’re tracking heat records in 400 U.S. cities, and you can look up your city.

hed: We think this cool study we found is flawed. Help us reproduce it.
tease: We found this cool study about age and randomness, but we think it is flawed. Can you help us reproduce it?

hed: Who’s in Your Wallet?
tease: We looked at more than 200 banknotes to see who’s represented on today’s currencies around the world.

hed: How many days since a record-high temperature?
tease: How many days since a record temperature high? Check the always-updating scoreboard.

hed: The NBA Redrafted 2.0
tease: What could have been for your favorite NBA team? A data-driven revisionist history of the NBA draft.

hed: What Makes Writing More Readable?
tease: Want to make your writing more accessible? Algorithms might not be the answer.

hed: When Women Make Headlines
tease: Analyzing more than 382,000 headlines to see how women are represented (or misrepresented) in the news.

hed: Help a Computer Win the New Yorker Cartoon Caption Contest
tease: We tried to win the New Yorker Cartoon Caption Contest by making AI-generated captions.

hed: Deepwork
tease: Learn how to hack your digital DNA to achieve the mid-level corporate career of your dreams.

hed: The Hidden Risks of Sesame Allergies
tease: We investigated 200 crackers to learn about food allergies and labelling. Warning: may contain troubling results.

hed: Can Data Die? Tracking the Lenna Image
tease: We scraped the web to track one of the internet’s oldest images — one that lives on without the subject’s consent.

hed: How you play Spades is how you play life
tease: Through data and interviews, learn why the card game Spades is the perfect metaphor for the African-American community.

hed: Ranking the Biggest NBA Finals Carry Jobs
tease: For groups to succeed, sometimes one person will shoulder more than their fair share of the work. Just ask LeBron James.

hed: A Visual History of Rickrolling
tease: A visual history of Rickrolling — millions of comments, posts, and links — that’s never gonna let you down.

hed: “I Kissed A Girl” to “Call Me By Your Name”
tease: A story about hearing yourself in same-gender pop lyrics for the first time and tracking it with data ever since.

hed: How many artists overshadow their band after going solo?
tease: How many artists overshadow their band after going solo? We crunched the numbers.

hed: Get out of your geographic music bubble
tease: To help you get out of your geographic music bubble, we found the songs that are most popular far away from you.

hed: How Science Came Together During COVID-19
tease: Science stepped up: on average there were ~11 new coronavirus articles coming out each hour, every hour throughout 2020.

hed: The Naked Truth
tease: Not all nudes are the same. We looked at how names for 6,816 makeup foundations can reveal bias in the beauty industry.

hed: Wine & Math: A Model Pairing
tease: This model attempts to predict a wine’s quality. We detect a note of math, with a hint of 0s and 1s.

hed: Nothing Breaks Like A.I. Heart
tease: What do you do when your friends are sick of hearing about your breakup? Use a supercomputer to find a happier ending.

hed: Introducing the Live Music Analyst
tease: Our auditory analyst compares 770 artists’ live recordings with their and studio counterparts. Music snobs rejoice!

hed: Every time someone says cool in Community
tease: We tracked every time someone says "cool" in community. Cool. Cool. Cool.

hed: Oreos and the Art of Crossword Puzzle Construction
tease: Clue: We crunched the data on this controversial cookie and condiment crossword clue. Answer: Oreo.

hed: How Bad is Your Streaming Music?
tease: How bad is your Spotify or Apple music? Our sophisticated A.I. judges your awful taste.

hed: The Historical Cost of Light
tease: Candles and LEDs don’t pay for themselves. We’ll demonstrate just exactly how much work goes into warding off the dark.

hed: Who’s in the Crossword?
tease: Crosswords are known for being too old, too white, and too male. We backed that up with data.

hed: Welcome to the Cloud Zoo
tease: Need a cute animal fix? Here’s a menagerie of live-streams from your favorite zoos and aquariums all in one place.

hed: How officer complaints are investigated
tease: Philly openly reports about complaints against police officers. But we found that public doesn’t equal transparent.

hed: This is an Experiment about How We View History
tease: Take the quiz: Can you identify when these photos were taken? It may not be as easy as it sounds.

hed: Why are K-pop groups so big?
tease: We tracked K-pop group sizes and member roles over modern K-pop’s 30-year history. BTS Army click here.

hed: A Data-Led Theory to Generationally Divide Dance Floors
tease: A data comic to help you understand how the dance floor is generationally divided.

hed: How rigid is the middle class in the US, really?
tease: Using 50 years of data, we explored economic mobility and determined just how rigid the middle class really is.

hed: How candidate diversity impacts color diversity
tease: We examined 271 presidential candidate branding designs from 1968–2020. Here’s who goes beyond the red, WHITE, and blue.

hed: Defining the ’90s Music Canon
tease: We quizzed people on how well they recognized ’90s songs by their birth year. Britney and Whitney have staying power.

hed: The Physical Traits that Define Men and Women in Literature
tease: What physical traits are most tied to gender in literature? Eye roll: Women are all soft thighs and red lips.

hed: Flooding in America
tease: Nearly 14.6M properties in America are in a flood zone, with more likely in the near future. We mapped the scenarios.

hed: You Know Karen
tease: Using baby name data, we found the names that could be at risk of becomming future "Karens" in 10, 20, and 30 years.

hed: A Data-driven Trip Through the USA
tease: Where do Tripadvisor reviewers go when they’re staying local? Our guide to 74,762 US attractions will tell you.

hed: An Illustrated Guide to Masked Wrestlers
tease: Do you smell what we’re cooking? It’s stories, facts, and pixel art drawings of over 200 masked wrestlers.

hed: Identifying Generational Gaps in Music
tease: Take this quiz to see if you’re better than others your age at recognizing songs from history.

hed: The Infinite Monkey Theorem Experiment
tease: What happens when you combine music, a monkey, Joe Rogan, and probability? You get this experiment.

hed: Just How Does Kidz Bop Censor Songs?
tease: When it comes to sanitizing lyrics, where does Kidz Bop draw the line? (This was pre-WAP though; now all bets are off.)

hed: The Evolution of the American Census
tease: To learn about the US’ evolving priorities, norms and biases, we collected every question to ever appear on a census.

hed: The Emotional GIF Range of Celebs
tease: Emojis are nice, but GIFs have range. We looked at how we use these looped clips of celebs to convey feelings.

hed: Where will you need your umbrella?
tease: These are the cities where you’ll need your umbrella, ella, ella, eh, eh, eh. Seattle may be less rainy than you think.

hed: The Cultural Borders of Songs
tease: Find your new jam here. We mapped several month of #1 songs in 3,000 places.

hed: Do Authors Write Where They Know?
tease: Do authors write where they know? We calculated the distance between where authors lived and where their books were set.

hed: Where International Communities Cluster
tease: America has often been called a nation of immigrants. We mapped where they settled.

hed: The Aftermath of a YouTube Apology
tease: Will saying sorry save your reputation? We quantified the lasting impact of a YouTube appology and controversy.

hed: The Worst, Highest-Paid NBA Player, Ever
tease: Ranking player performance against pay, we found the worst, highest-paid NBA player, ever. Sorry, Melo.

hed: The Big Data of Big Hair
tease: From beehives, to afros, to bumpits: we looked at 30,000 yearbook photos to officially crown the "Big Hair Era."

hed: Laughing OnLine
tease: Do you "lol?" Or "haha?’ Or "hehe?" We charted the usage, evolution, and perception of digital laughter.

hed: The Kim Foxx Effect
tease: When an elected official promises to transform prosecution, do their actions live up to their words? We investigated.

hed: Where Do Adoptable Dogs in Your State Come From?
tease: Everything’s bigger in Texas, even the number of exported adoptable dogs. Here’s where the dogs in your state are from.

hed: Ye Olde Mad-Lib Pub Crawl Generator
tease: We’ve devised pub crawl routes between UK watering holes of the same name. One Red Lion down, 338 to go. Cheers!

hed: Is “Ass” the Most Complicated Word in English?
tease: Is “ass” the most complicated word in English? We tracked down 201 historic usages and compared it to other slang.

hed: The Millennial Question
tease: Headlines say millennials killed napkins, marriage, and Applebees. We say, "you’re welcome." What’s next for this group?

hed: Are Men Singing Higher in Pop Music?
tease: Are men singing higher in pop songs today? Biebs, the JoBros, the Weeknd, we’re coming for you... with data.

hed: Top-Selling Book Covers, Arranged by Visual Similarity
tease: Are book covers starting to look the same? We organized over 5,000 top-seling book covers by visual similarity.

hed: Hipster Summer Reading List 2019
tease: Our 2019 hipster summer reading list will introduce you to an artisanal selection of obscure books before they’re cool.

hed: A Chronicle of the Anti-vaccination Movement
tease: Using news coverage, we plotted how one highly unethical study on vaccines has caused outsized, irreparable harm.

hed: Best Year in Music
tease: Sit back and relax as we take you on an updated journey through every Billboard Top 5 hit to find music’s greatest era.

hed: A People Map of the UK
tease: We made a map that replaces UK city names with their most Wikipedia’ed resident.

hed: A People Map of the US
tease: We made a map that replaces US city names with their most Wikipedia’ed resident.

hed: How Often Names are in Songs
tease: Billie Jean is not my lover, but it’s one of the names we tracked for this project. Here’s how often names are in songs.

hed: How Much Data Lies Behind the Paper You’re Reading?
tease: Want to access the raw data behind an academic paper? OK. Has it been a few years? Yeah... good luck with that.

hed: The Rise of Hyphenated Last Names in Pro Sports
tease: Since the 1950s, hyphenated last names in pro-sports have been on the rise. The WNBA leads the way, as it so often does.

hed: The NBA Has a Defensive Three Seconds Problem
tease: The NBA has a defensive three seconds problem. We tracked how often players are camped in the paint.

hed: Colorism in High Fashion
tease: We looked at 19 years of covers to see if Vogue represents women of all shades. You can guess how this went.

hed: Why Budapest, Warsaw, and Lithuania split themselves in two
tease: Why are European regions shifting their borders? We follow the money.

hed: How Algorithms Know What You’ll Type Next
tease: Computers now have four different methods to determine what you’ll type now/next/nexis

hed: Women’s Issues Within Political Party Platforms
tease: We looked at every political party platform between 1840 and 2016 to find how often women’s issues appeared in the text.

hed: NBA Spelling Bee
tease: Can you spell the hardest names in the NBA? Or will you miss and spell H-O-R-S-E?

hed: Who is the Biggest Pop Star?
tease: How do you measure who’s the biggest pop star? We tackle that question a bunch of different ways.

hed: How Many High School Stars Make It in the NBA?
tease: Do high school basketball stars live up to the hype? Here’s how many find success in the NBA.

hed: The Gyllenhaal Experiment
tease: Think Gyllenhaal is a hard name to spell? It gets worse. Here are the many ways to misspell big names in pop culture.

hed: The Sexualized Messages Dress Codes are Sending to Students
tease: School dress codes send the wrong messages about womens’ and girls’ bodies. An analysis of 481 policies shows why.

hed: Rappers, Sorted by the Size of their Vocabulary
tease: Who’s the most prolific rapper of all time? We try to answer that by measure vocabulary. Happy debating.

hed: A Brief History of the Past 100 Years
tease: We created a brief history of the past 100 years from New York Times headlines. And yes, there are word clouds.

hed: The World through the Eyes of the US
tease: These are the countries that have most preoccupied Americans since 1900, according to New York Times headlines.

hed: Population Mountains
tease: This is a story about how to perceive the population size of cities. Hint: perspective helps.

hed: Internet Boy Band Database
tease: Because you just can’t get enough of them, we found every boy band to chart the Hot 100 since 1980.

hed: 30 Years of American Anxieties
tease: Dear Abby, I’m looking for an analysis of 20,000 advice column letters. Sincerely, Curious. Hi Curious, click this link.

hed: The Winningest Cities in North American Sports
tease: Welcome to Titletown! Discover the most successful cities across baseball, basketball, football, hockey, and soccer.

hed: Human Terrain: Population in 3D
tease: We charted new terrain in these 3D maps of human population.

hed: What Does the Path to Fame Look Like?
tease: From Cardi B to Carson Wentz: we charted the path to fame from Wikipedia pageviews.

hed: A Visual History of Every Air Jordan
tease: Watch as the design of the iconic Air Jordan morphs from its the first release in 1985 to the present.

hed: The Celebrity Billboard Project
tease: Here’s who was the most popular person on Wikipedia ever day in 2018.

hed: The Most Emo Lyrics: Emo Rap vs. Dashboard Confessional
tease: Who has more emotionally vulnerable lyrics, emo-rap or Dashboard Confessional? We measured each album’s sentiment.

hed: Film or Digital?
tease: Let’s get reel: who’s using film and who’s using digital in the movie industry?

hed: Women’s Pockets are Inferior
tease: We went there. A data investigation into the travesty that is women’s pockets.

hed: Life After Death on Wikipedia
tease: What Wikipedia pageviews tell us about how famous people are remembered after they die. RIP.

hed: Tech Jobs may not Solve America’s Looming Automation Crisis
tease: The job automation crisis isn’t as simple as turning truck driver’s into developers. We break it down with data.

hed: What Airport Traffic Tells Us About the World’s Megacities
tease: Instead of measuring a city by it’s GDP or population, what if we measure it by its airport traffic?

hed: Let’s Talk About Birth Control
tease: No TMI here, just 20,759 people describing their experiences with contraception... and us charting it.

hed: The Road to Gender Parity in the House of Representatives
tease: We looked at 500,000 congressional speeches to show how gender representation changes the conversation.

hed: Men are from Chelsea, Women are from Park Slope
tease: We mapped how "gayborhoods" are divided by gender. It’s true: men are from Chelsea, women are from Park Slope.

hed: The Diversity of Makeup Shades
tease: Fenty is a champion for makeup inclusivity, but how do other brands compare? We charted their foundation skin tones.

hed: The Good, the Rad, and the Gnarly
tease: The good, the rad, and the gnarly. We took a look at what makes a skate soundtrack.

hed: The Most-Viewed NBA Plays in 2017-18
tease: A supercut of the most-viewed NBA plays from 2017–18. Warning: this video contains a high dosage of LeBron footage.

hed: Are Hit Songs Becoming Less Musically Diverse?
tease: Think you’ve heard that before? Turns out, hit songs are becoming less musically diverse.

hed: Baking the Most Average Chocolate Chip Cookie
tease: We baked the most average chocolate chip cookie. Recipes written by computers — what could go wrong?

hed: One-Hit Wonders in Sports
tease: Which athletes qualify as one-hit wonders? We charted the greatest single-season anomalies in the last 30 years.

hed: The Birthday Paradox Experiment
tease: Your birthday twin is probably reading this right now. We take on the birthday paradox.

hed: A Tale of Two Cities
tease: In a love letter to NYC and Seattle, we pinpoint the types of businesses that distinguish one neighborhood from another.

hed: The Structure of Stand-Up Comedy
tease: We watched Ali Wong’s Baby Cobra too many times and charted out how she built the routine around a laughter climax.

hed: Let’s Learn About Waveforms
tease: Here’s an interactive guide that introduces and explores waveforms. Volume most defintiely on.

hed: Limbo Lines: Dead Here, Alive There
tease: We mapped which countries have laws and guidelines around declaring brain death.

hed: Mapping Gastronomic Borders in the US
tease: What is the taco capital of the US? Where does BBQ reign supreme? These maps have you covered.

hed: Greetings from Mars
tease: Via postcards from the Curiosity Rover on Mars, we prove that talking about the weather is a universal habit.

hed: How CNN, MSNBC, and FOX Cover the News
tease: There are three sides to every cable news story: MSNBC’s, Fox News’, and CNN’s. The contrast in on-screen text is stark.

hed: 10 Things Everyone Hates About You
tease: We can all agree that drain hair is gross. But it’s a thin line between love and hate for more than 3,000 other topics.

hed: Newspapers: A Black & White Issue
tease: What is black and white and red all over? The racial gap between a newspaper’s staff and the community it covers.

hed: What is a Superteam in the NBA?
tease: How would you define an NBA superteam? We couldn’t decide so we built this tool to give you the power.

hed: The Words That Are “Most Hip Hop”
tease: In a musial language that’s gone worldwide, we uncover the words that are "most hip-hop"

hed: Listen to Her: Gender on This American Life
tease: If you exclude Ira Glass’ voice, who gets the most airtime on This American Life: men or women? Stay tuned to hear more.

hed: An Analysis of Driving Times to Abortion Clinics in the US
tease: In 2017, we mapped the cities and places with the worst access to abortion based on driving times.

hed: She Giggles, He Gallops
tease: Men "gallop" and women "giggle," at least according to the gendered tropes found in 2,000 scripts.

hed: ‘The Office’ Dialogue in Five Charts
tease: We measured the dialogue from every episode of The Office and it sure is a mouthful. (“That’s what she said.")

hed: The Dining Habits and Companions of Americans
tease: I’m dining solo, I’m dining solo, solo (Jason Derulo voice). We looked at the dining habits and companions of Americans.

hed: Gender Representation of 34,476 Comic Book Characters
tease: Female characters are largely absent from superhero comics — but when they are included, how are they depicted?

hed: Why the Republican Party Wins When Robots Take Your Job
tease: Everytime a job is automated, the Republican Party benefits.

hed: Free Willy and Flipper by the Numbers
tease: What’s best for animals in aquariums? We look to the past & present to gauge the future of captive whales and dolphins.

hed: Plot Trends for Top-Grossing Film from the Past 50 Years
tease: A story about how film plots mirror (or shape) historical events.

hed: Bias, She Wrote
tease: Has American literature made progress toward gender equality, or is commercial success still linked to an author’s bio?

hed: The Timing of Baby Making
tease: Hurricanes, bankruptcies, and the World Series are all said to spark baby booms.But is there any truth to these tales?

hed: Are Pop Lyrics Getting More Repetitive?
tease: In the words of Ms. Spears, "Oops, I did it again." We show how pop lyrics are getting more repetitive.

hed: The Most Timeless NBA Plays
tease: What’s the most timeless NBA play? We turn to YouTube views to determine which have the most replay value.

hed: What City is the Microbrew Capital of the US?
tease: Let’s raise a pint to the microbrew capitals of the U.S. Cheers!

hed: Why Does the US Lead the World in Incarceration?
tease: Why does the U.S. lead the world in incarceration? We try to answer this question with data.

hed: The Geographic Divide of Oscars Films
tease: Like teams in the Super Bowl, the popularity of Oscar contenders can also be regional. Here are the hotspots from 2017.

hed: NBA Last Two Minute Report
tease: A lot can happen in the last 2:00 of an NBA game and the refs don’t always get it right. We tracked the calls in 2018.

hed: The Emergence Of Slang, Using Search Data
tease: We used Google search data to measure slang, and it has us shook.

hed: Mapping Slavery Against US Incarceration
tease: Inspired by Ava DuVernay’s documentary 13th, we mapped the change from "slave to criminal with one amendment."

hed: The Unlikely Odds of Making it Big
tease: What are the odds an artist will make it big? Three years and 75,000 concerts later, we finally have an answer.

hed: An Interactive Visualization of Every Line in Hamilton
tease: This is the site where it happens. We visualized every line from Hamilton.

hed: How News Media Covers Trump & Clinton
tease: We analyzed 12,147 images to see how the media covers Trump and Clinton. It’s not a pretty picture.

hed: Twenty Years of the NBA Redrafted
tease: Hindsight is 20/20. We redraft decades of NBA picks using their career stats to find the breakouts and the busts.

hed: How Robert Glasper Sampled Miles Davis on “Ghetto Walkin”
tease: An interactive story of what happens when a genius samples a genius: Robert Glasper, Miles Davis and “Ghetto Walkin.”

hed: The 2,452 Wikipedia Pages on which Miles Davis is Mentioned
tease: Miles Davis is mentioned on 2,452 Wikipedia pages. We analyzed them all.

hed: Ranking the Most Unlikely NBA Comebacks
tease: These are the most unlikely NBA comebacks from the 2015–16 season. Harden, Curry, James: the gang’s all here.

hed: The Largest Analysis of Film Dialogue by Gender, Ever
tease: This is the largest analysis of film dialogue by gender. Yes, even Disney has films with fewer lines for women.

hed: Crowdsourcing the Definition of “Punk”
tease: What counts as "punk" music? We turned to Spotify and YouTube playlists to answer this question.

hed: Hollywood’s Gender Divide and its Effect on Films
tease: Here are the writers, directors, and producers who make films that fail the Bechdel test.

hed: The Most Succesful Labels in Hip Hop
tease: Is it an east coast vs. west coast thing? Every hip hop record label, since 1989, sorted by Billboard chart performance.

hed: The Most Timeless Songs of All-Time
tease: We used Spotify plays to track the most timeless songs of all-time.

hed: Outkast, in Charts
tease: How Outkast brought their southern roots to hip hop, in charts.
